Lady Hawk remained calm and collected, this bot she was associating 
with obviously knew very little about civilized societies. "If you 
keep that tone you will surely blow a gasket. Now run along like a 
good little insecticon and tell your master I'm waiting." Lady hawk 
considered the possibility of a confrontation. She wasn't worried, 
she had Battera sized up from the start, Lady Hawk had the advantage 
in all aspects, size, strength, and a few technological advantages 
that were gifts from her father.

 --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> ::Battera::
> 
> She could take threats, she could take getting shot at. But this 
> walking feather duster pushed all her buttons.  She spread out her 
> wings to full span and looked at Lady Hawk. She  said in a an 
> agrivated voice,"One: I have not been cursed by being royalty. Two, 
> Your tone of voice is that of a low life protoform. Third, I am not 
a 
> serving bot. I am a warrior in the Allience. And I don't give a 
piece 
> of scrap whether our guns bother you or not. They will kill you. 
And 
> that's all I care about."  She had her hands balled into fists and 
> was about to throw a punch at this very annoying, arrogant, 
ignorant, 
> femmebot.  She forced herself to calm down. She opened her link to 
> Zardus. "I got this femmebot out here who said that she was sent by 
> Devilduer to come here and join us. I have my opinions on the 
matter 
> but that is your decision."  She looked at LadyHawk. "Wait here 
> untill Zardus arrives for you."  SHe slammed the entrance door on 
> LadyHawk and fumed .  She was totally and completely filled with 
rage 
> and hatred for that walking pile of feathers and frill.  She leaned 
> against the door and waited for Zardus.  She knew she would have to 
> work with the feather brained thing ouside the door if Zardus 
> commanded her to, but that didn't mean she would have to like it.
> 
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > Deep down inside Lady Hawk felt almost insulted by the 
implication 
> that she
> > might be Maximal. "You will lower your tone in my presence!" she 
> exclaimed,
> > folding her wings at her side to look more appropriate as 
> royalty. "The
> > rules of courtesy state that we conduct exchanges of words based 
on
> > civility." the female bot stated as suredly as it had been told 
to 
> her a
> > cycle ago. " Not according to the obvious difference in our 
social 
> skills.
> > The snide female looked down on Baterra without trying.
> > 
> > "To answer your first question I was sent here by DevilDuer to 
work 
> for the
> > alliance" she paused for a moment before breaking one of the 
rules 
> of
> > courtesy "your second question I am a scientist working with DNA 
> ingrading."
> > Her eyes met Battera with a holier than thou look that royalty so 
> often has
> > with a commoner. "And your third question should be obvious even 
to 
> a
> > serving bot that I am not a Maximal.":
> > 
> > her gaze turned cold with disbelief that a nobody would have an 
> attitude
> > toward a higher being such as herself. "And don't even consider 
your
> > autoguns a threat, if I'd worried about them they wouldn't still 
> exist."
> > Lady Hawk turned her back to Baterra as if to brush her aside, "I 
> eliminate
> > anything that I find" She glanced back a moment to hint at her 
> words. "A
> > nuisance."
> > 
> >

> arrogance
> > > of that to match  the size of the continant they were standing 
on.
> > >
> > > "Oh, Forgive me. I had no ideawe had royalty coming." she said 
in 
> a
> > > very sarcastic voice. "Now state your business." She blocked 
the 
> door
> > > and looked sternfully at the her. "Or the autoguns will open 
fire.
> > > What are you? Maximal?"
> > >
> > >

> firing so
> > > she must
> > > > have done something right. She stared at the scanner trying 
to 
> piece
> > > > together her mistake. She thought hard for a few moments 
before 
> the
> > > > realization hit her. she'd stayed in her half organic mode so 
> the
> > > scanners
> > > > picked up her as well as Devilduer. "Well if thats the way 
you 
> want
> > > to play
> > > > this game I can play too." if the guns were to fire she'd be 
> ready.
> > > >
> > > > Battera's cold greeting caught Lady Hawk off gaurd. a quick 
> relapse
> > > of the
> > > > battle helped her a little. "I am Lady Hawk, daughter of 
Veratis
> > > and member
> > > > of the royal family of Avaria. and I find it to be an insult 
to
> > > have your
> > > > guns facing me.
> > > >

the

> > > > taps a
> > > > > few keys to stop the autoguns from opening fire.
> > > > >
> > > > > "There's a bot near the entrance," he says to Battera, "Can 
> you
> > > show her
> > > > in,
> > > > > ask her what she wants, and make sure she doesn't go loose 
in 
> the
> > > base? I
> > > > > have to attend to this bot."
